transcript.title: PM 68/1964 - Victorian By-Election
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS P. M. 68/ 1964

I offer my good wishes to the Victorian Government for Saturday's Legislative Council by-election.

Whatever differences of opinion may exist on particular matters and there always will be differences the dominant issue on Saturday is whether Mr. Boltets government is to retain a majority in both Houses, or go back to a position where any government policy may be frustrated by an adverse vote in the Upper House. Similar questions will arise at the next Senate Election. The record of the Bol-e Government is a very fine and progressive one. The electors of Victoria recently gave it tneir warm and clear approval, I am sure that they will affirm their decision on Saturday,

CANBERRA
8th October, 1964.
